snippet.title: Hell's Kitchen Australia stars Sam Frost and Candice Warner rise above reality TV bickering
snippet.content:
Sam Frost and Candice Warner for Hell's Kitchen 0:26
Sam Frost and Candice Warner chat to the Sunday Telegraph ahead of their Hell's Kitchen appearance
August 5th 2017 21 hours ago
Candice Warner and Sam Frost (right) pictured before the airing of reality TV show Hell's Kitchen on Sunday. Both are contestants in this years show. Picture: Sam Ruttyn
Amelia SawNews Corp Australia Network
Share
CANDICE Warner and Sam Frost may have been pitted against each other on Hell's Kitchen Australia. But the celebrity chefs will be keeping their claws safely concealed within their oven mitts. With Warner a member of the blue team - along with Willie Mason, Gary 'Gaz' Beadle, Debra Lawrence and Issa Schultz - and Frost in the red team - with Lincoln Lewis, David Oldfield, Pettifleur Berenger and Jess Fox - the competitive women could easily have come to blows.
Candice Warner and Sam Frost (left) pictured before the airing of reality TV show Hell's Kitchen on Sunday. Picture: Sam RuttynSource:News Corp Australia But instead they aligned themselves with the sisterhood. "I don't think anyone who has met Sam could dislike her," said Warner, 32. "She's so lovely, so down to earth and just brings so much enthusiasm to the group, she's one of those girls that when she walks into the room she lights it up."
Candice Warner and Sam Frost (left) have chosen sisterhood instead. Picture: Sam RuttynSource:News Corp Australia And Frost was pushed to find a bad word about the famous Iron-woman. "You can tell she's a great mum. I'm such a supporter of women and she's just a cool chick," she said. But when it came to Pettifleur Berrenger, the blue-eyed sweetheart had to choose her words more carefully.
Candice Warner and Sam Frost (right) have interesting views of the other contestants. Picture: Sam RuttynSource:News Corp Australia "Pettifleur is an interesting cat, she talks a lot," said Frost, 28.
"I talk a lot but she's look a kookaburra! She just keeps going and going and going ... Marco had to pull her up quite a lot about the fact she just doesn't stop talking." Read the full interview about Candice Warner's time on Hell's Kitchen Australia in this Sunday's TV guide.
Hells Kitchen Australia 0:20
Marco Pierre White runs the new series of Hells Kitchen Australia Courtesy: Seven
August 4th 2017 2 days ago
